result.execSummary:
The defendant Victoriano Botello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.    All applicable fees of supervison.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent with count two.  Credit for one (1) day.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent with count one.  Credit for one (1) day.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (17 pages) commencing 09-11-2015 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Victoriano Botello in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Katie Seelow for Nicholas Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but concurrent to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but concurrent to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse 

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.  
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
PSI received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Victoriano Botello in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.    Court ordered a presentence investigation with a recommendation.  Order for Presentence Investigation filed. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victoriano Botello in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Branch 15.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Victoriano Botello in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms. Written order received and filed.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  5/29/15. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Victoriano Botello in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/28/15 @ 1:30 pm
